While federal prosecutors spent about eight weeks building their case, the defense declined to call any witnesses. “We do not believe the government has met their burden of proving the charges against Mr. Rezko, plain and simple,” Joseph J. Duffy, Mr. Rezko’s chief lawyer, said outside the courtroom. Among the government’s final witnesses was Ali Ata, a former high-ranking state official who provided testimony after pleading guilty to lying to the F.B.I. in another case. Closing arguments in Mr. Rezko’s trial are scheduled for next Monday.

abstract: A look at some of the photos that voters have submitted over the past months.
snippet: A look at some of the photos that voters have submitted over the past months.
lead_paragraph: The results keep coming in. Since we began asking for your photos back in February, hundreds of readers from San Diego to Strasbourg, Jakarta to Jersey City, have submitted images to the Polling Place Photo Project, our joint effort with the AIGA, the national association for design. The Polling Place Photo Project was created in 2006 by William Drenttel and AIGA during the midterm elections.The photos range from the quirky to the mundane – a bevy of ballot boxes, curtains, and levers – representing the far-flung corners of the nation. Often the images stray yards, perhaps miles, from the polling sites themselves, spilling out onto streets, walkways, and even cemeteries. Together they form a “voter-generated” portrait of the election season.

headline.main: Your Photos Here

lead_paragraph: Cindy McCain said Thursday that she would never release her personal income tax filing even if her husband, Senator John McCain, was elected president. But Federal Aviation Administration records indicate that she appears to be using her personal wealth to help his campaign, through the continued use of her corporate jet.The New York Times reported last month that during a crucial five-month period Mr. McCain’s campaign regularly used a corporate jet owned by the Phoenix-based beer distributor that Mrs. McCain heads, saving the campaign hundreds of thousands of dollars. His campaign pays rates well below market ones for the plane’s use because of an unresolved exemption in a recent campaign finance law that Mr. McCain backed.

abstract: Hundreds of people, mostly supporters of Hillary Clinton, showed up outside a Democratic National Committee meeting in Washington urging the party leaders to seat delegates from Florida and Michigan.
snippet: Hundreds of people, mostly supporters of Hillary Clinton, showed up outside a Democratic National Committee meeting in Washington urging the party leaders to seat delegates from Florida and Michigan.
lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — A raucous crowd of several hundred gathered outside a Washington hotel where the rules committee of the Democratic Party is poised to make a decision about the seating of delegates from Florida and Michigan.

headline.main: Outside the D.N.C. Meeting

abstract: Tony Blair, the former prime minister of Britain, unveiled plans for an ambitious new charity that he hopes will enlist religion as a force for economic development and conflict resolution.
snippet: Tony Blair, the former prime minister of Britain, unveiled plans for an ambitious new charity that he hopes will enlist religion as a force for economic development and conflict resolution.
lead_paragraph: Tony Blair, the former prime minister of Britain, formally unveiled plans in New York City on Friday for an ambitious new charity that he hopes will enlist religion as a force for economic development and conflict resolution, rather than violence and strife.

headline.main: Blair Charity to Enlist Religion as a Positive Force
headline.print_headline: Blair Charity to Enlist Religion as a Positive Force

abstract: The Clinton campaign expressed disappointment that Senator Barack Obama did not reject the Rev. Michael Pfleger more forcefully after the priest mocked Senator Hillary Rodham Clinton.
snippet: The Clinton campaign expressed disappointment that Senator Barack Obama did not reject the Rev. Michael Pfleger more forcefully after the priest mocked Senator Hillary Rodham Clinton.
lead_paragraph: CHICAGO  Reverberations from the Sunday sermon of a Roman Catholic priest who mocked Senator Hillary Rodham Clinton at Senator Barack Obama’s home church here continued to spread Friday, after the priest offered an apology and the archbishop of Chicago gave him a public reprimand for “partisan campaigning.”

headline.main: Mocking of Clinton at Obama’s Church Reverberates
headline.print_headline: Mocking of Clinton at Obama’s Church Reverberates

abstract: As hundreds of protesters demonstrated outside, party officials gathered to settle a dispute over Florida and Michigan delegates.
snippet: As hundreds of protesters demonstrated outside, party officials gathered to settle a dispute over Florida and Michigan delegates.
lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON  A Democratic Party committee tried Saturday to resolve the disputes over primary votes in Florida and Michigan, with Senator Hillary Rodham Clinton’s campaign calling for the delegations to be seated essentially as if there had been no questions about the validity of the contests and Senator Barack Obama’s campaign for the first time laying out its proposal for a portion of the delegates to be seated.

headline.main: Democrats Debate Seating Delegates From Two States
headline.print_headline: Democrats Debate Disputed Delegates

byline.original: By Katharine Q. Seelye and Jeff Zeleny
